Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident Reporting
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility is not notifying case managers when youth go AWOL.
Facility is not communicating properly regarding youth or making
themselves available for communication when case managers
attempt to contact the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 5,
2025. Director said he is the Senior Director of Residential
Services and in that capacity is an on-call administrator and
supervisor to Therapist and Case Manager. Director said when
Youth runaway the supervisors will notify Therapist or Case
Manager during business hours and afterhours will notify the on-
call administrator. Director said he is one of the administrator’s
that make notifications of AWOL’s to the appropriate individuals
both during business hours if needed and after hours when on-
call. Director said Youth AWOL’s frequently and notifications are
made either via email to Foster Care Worker or Youth’s on-call
caseworker. Director said Youth’s foster care agency has
requested the facility make notifications to the foster care agency
on-call case worker after 5pm however noted the on-call worker
does not come out to the facility to assist in the AWOL search.
Director said the facility makes a police report as soon as Youth
AWOL’s and then upon his return the police department requires
the facility to bring Youth to the police department to be removed
from the runaway list. Director said at times this has been difficult
to do timely as Youth will return dysregulated and is not always
safe to place in a vehicle until the following day when many times
he would run away again, and they would just use the same police
report. Director said the foster care agency has not reported any
other concerns to him regarding lack of communication.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on May 28, 2025.
Therapist said she works with Youth and has been in continual
communication with Foster Care Worker. Therapist said Youth
runs away from the facility frequently and she has completed
many notifications to Foster Care Worker. Therapist said if it is
during business hours of 9am to 5pm the Foster Care Worker is
emailed however after 5pm and on weekends the foster care
2

agency has requested the notifications are called into an on-call
worker. Therapist said calling an on-call worker is not the normal
practice of the facility as they typically email the assigned worker
the information. Therapist said Foster Care Worker had brought
concern about the facility not calling the foster care agency’s on-
call worker but instead sending the email which the facility has
since rectified. Therapist said the foster care agency on-call
worker does not come and assist or provide any guidance or
information. Therapist said foster care agency has not reported
any other concerns to her regarding lack of communication.
Therapist said Youth has had safety plans to address the running
away and to her knowledge all staff are following the plans.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on May 28,
2025. Foster Care Worker said she is assigned to Youth’s case
and has had contact with Methodist Children’s Home. Foster Care
Worker originally said she has “a lot of communication issues”
with the facility however then stated, “Case Manager, Therapist,
and [Director] have been great with communication”. Foster Care
Worker said she had concerns about being notified about Youth’s
AWOLs hours after he had run away. Foster Care Worker said her
main concern was that she was not being properly notified when
Youth returned from AWOL, and that the police reports were not
always accurate for if Youth was AWOL or not. Foster Care
Worker said it is her expectation the facility notify her within 15
minutes of Youth running away and within 15 minutes of his
return. Foster Care Worker said she told the facility during
business hours they can contact her but after business hours and
on the weekends the expectation is for them to call the foster care
agency’s on-call worker which is not always occurring. Foster
Care Worker said the foster care agency on-call worker will send
an email notification to her and her supervisor, program manager
when notified of Youth’s AWOL. Foster Care Worker said she then
has to notify WMPC once she receives the AWOL notification.
Foster Care Worker said the Redford Police do not always have
accurate information regarding Youth’s whereabouts and there
have been times when she has contacted Redford Police, and
they still have Youth considered AWOL when he is back at the
facility and vice versa. Foster Care Worker said she has helped
develop safety plans for Youth and she believes Therapist, Case
Manager, and Director follow the plans however she is unsure if
the direct care staff are following the plans but could not provide
instances where the plan was not being implemented.
Redford Police was interviewed via telephone on June 3,
2025. Redford Police said it is protocol for Methodist Children’s
3

Home to go into the police department to make a report for youth
running away and when the youth return the requirement is for
them to bring the youth to the police department so they can “lay
eyes on them” and ask the youth some questions. Redford Police
was familiar with Youth and stated, “he has so many runaway
reports”.
Case Manager was interviewed via telephone on June 3, 2025.
Case Manager said she is the assigned case manager for Youth,
as part of this role she has made notifications to Foster Care
Worker for Youth’s AWOLs. Case Manager said if it is during
business hours the staff will contact supervisors who then contact
either her, Therapist, or Director who will make the required
AWOL notifications. Case Manager said Foster Care Worker did
notify the facility that they wanted them to call the foster care
agency on-call number to report Youth AWOL if it was after
business hours or on the weekend. Case Manager said she does
not know if that is still an ongoing issue. Case Manager said she
has not been told by Foster Care Worker or anyone else that there
are issues with a lack of communication between the facility and
foster care agency. Case Manager said Youth has been on safety
plans for AWOLing and to her knowledge everyone is following
those safety plans.
Documents Reviewed:
• Methodist Children’s Home Runaway/AWOL Policy was
reviewed. The policy for notifications to foster care worker
is for direct staff to notify their immediate supervisor who
then notifies the therapist who will notify the foster care
worker. The direct care staff will notify the police when a
youth AWOLs.

Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as there are several
incidents where Youth ran away from the facility and the facility
did not notify the foster care agency immediately as required.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
